learning_outcomes.description: Prepare reformulated financial statements to facilitate financial statement analysis and equity valuation.
Undertake financial ratio analysis to determine the drivers of profitability and growth.
Assess accounting quality and familiarise with the motivations for earnings management.
Prepare pro forma forecasts of the financial statements based on sales forecasts, growth rates, and ratios.

Work collaboratively in a team to develop and present a cohesive financial statement analysis and valuation report by using the appropriate valuation model and employing clear communication to support insights and final buy-sell recommendations.

assessments.task_description:
This project requires students to complete a detailed financial statement analysis of an Australian-listed company. The project will be completed in three parts.

Part one of the project is based on the concepts taught in the first four classes.

Note also:

  • Detailed instructions will be provided on Blackboard.
  • Students need to choose a company to analyse .
  • This is a group assessment.
  • You must provide your supporting workings in Excel. Excel work must reflect correct financial modelling conventions, which will be discussed in the class.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your Excel workings through Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This project requires students to complete a detailed financial statement analysis of an Australian-listed company. The project will be completed in three parts.

Part two of the project is based on the concepts taught in the first eight classes.

Note also:

  • Detailed instructions will be provided on Blackboard.
  • Students continue to analyse the same company that was analysed in part one of the project.
  • This is a group assessment.
  • You must provide your supporting workings in Excel. Excel work must reflect correct financial modelling conventions, which will be discussed in the class.

AI Statement:

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your written answers through the Turnitin link on Learn.UQ.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
This project requires students to complete a detailed financial statement analysis of an Australian-listed company. The project will be completed in three parts.

Part three of the project requires the students to present their analysis completed in part two. Each group will be given a maximum of ten minutes to present their valuation report and recommendation.

Note also:

  • Detailed instructions will be provided on Blackboard.
  • This is a group assessment.

AI Statement

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: Late submissions are not accepted for in-class presentations. Failure to present at the scheduled time will result in a mark of zero.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
Exam questions will address practical and conceptual issues covered over the full course.

The exam is an on-campus, closed book, and paper-based exam invigilated by UQ appointed invigilators.

AI Statement:

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of Generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.
